channel.title: Red orchestra 2 $5 on steam
channel.description:
If you want a super realistic shooter than isn't as frustratingly stupid as ARMA you should really get this
Its amazing. Tons of custom maps, 32vs32 wars
Isn't like call of duty at all, cover is actually useful, amazing built in cover system, can be shot in foot and hand and still survive, 1 shot to the torso will kill someone, guns aren't laser-beam accurate (theyre realistic)
and on max the game is sexy as love
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2edrjToqdeI
cool parts: 2:23-2:56 734-750 4:25 at 4:32 you can see he was hit in the wrist

item.title: Red orchestra 2 $5 on steam
item.dc:creator: @gravenfire23 gravenfire23
item.description:
@gravenfire23 wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:6, topic:476112”]I wish I would have saw this post 2 days ago(I can still buy it but I have spent like $300 on this sell. I need to not be doing that… thats about $200 less than a full weeks paycheck before taxes.). it looks like a nice game. I want to play a realistic FPS. I hate unloading a mag of ak into people on this one game and they not die but then again that game has a lot of laggers and it almost seems as if its programmed to the laggers benefit.[/quote]Same here, I’ve spent almost all of my Christmas money on steam lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Red orchestra 2 $5 on steam
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

I wish I would have saw this post 2 days ago(I can still buy it but I have spent like $300 on this sell. I need to not be doing that… thats about $200 less than a full weeks paycheck before taxes.). it looks like a nice game. I want to play a realistic FPS. I hate unloading a mag of ak into people on this one game and they not die but then again that game has a lot of laggers and it almost seems as if its programmed to the laggers benefit.
